intro: Anisochilus dysophylloides, commonly known as the slender-leafed anise tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Anisophylleaceae. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically elliptical or ovate in shape. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments. The fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that contains several seeds.
